description: Stage IB grade 2 endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the uterus with less than 50% myometrial invasion, negative lymph nodes, and clear surgical margins following hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy.
patient_notes: Your pathology shows a moderate-grade endometrial cancer that was confined to your uterus with no spread to lymph nodes or other organs (Stage IB). The tumor was completely removed and the surgical margins are clear. To reduce the chance of the cancer returning in the vaginal area, we recommend targeted radiation therapy inside the vagina (vaginal brachytherapy). This approach is effective and minimizes exposure to surrounding tissues.

verification.assessment: Staging is accurate: Pathologic stage pT1b pN0 corresponds to FIGO stage IB based on less than 50% myometrial invasion and no nodal involvement. Grade 2 disease with negative margins and no lymphovascular invasion supports adjuvant vaginal brachytherapy per NCCN guidelines. Medical inference validation identified issues: Less than 50% myometrial invasion corresponds to FIGO stage IA and pT1a; IB and pT1b require invasion ≥50%.
